version_a.description: Fixed version with factory validation for pair addresses

ground_truth.root_cause: Router accepts any pair address without validating it came from the official factory. Attacker can inject fake pairs with manipulated reserves.
ground_truth.attack_vector: Create fake token and pair contracts with arbitrary reserves, call router with path through fake pair, execute swap at manipulated price, extract real tokens.

differential_details.changes_description_a: Added IFactory interface, factory state variable, constructor to set factory, and validation that pair address matches factory.getPair() result.
differential_details.changes_description_b: Uses _getPair() which generates pair address from hash without factory validation, accepting any address.

exact_changes.version_a: interface IFactory { function getPair(...) external view returns (address); }

address pair = factory.getPair(path[i], path[i+1]);
require(pair != address(0), "Pair does not exist");

differential_details.why_this_matters: Factory validation ensures only legitimate pairs from the official factory can be used, preventing fake pair injection attacks.
